entry.et: Middle English, from Old English huntian; akin to Old English hentan to seize

def.dt: :to pursue for food or in sport hunt buffalo
:to manage in the search for game hunts a pack of dogs
:to pursue with intent to capture hunted the escapees
:to drive or chase especially by harrying members … were hunted from their homes J. T. Adams
:to traverse in search of prey hunts the woods
:to oscillate alternately to each side (as of a neutral point) or to run alternately faster and slower used especially of a device or machine
:to pursue game noiselessly usually without a dog
:to lie in wait for :approach by stealth
